memberdef.argsstring: (const iDynTree::MatrixDynSize &A, const iDynTree::MatrixDynSize &B, const iDynTree::MatrixDynSize &C, const iDynTree::MatrixDynSize &D)
memberdef.name: constructKalmanFilter

briefdescription.para: Describes the state propagation for a given dynamical system and the measurement model given the available measurements.

detaileddescription.para: If state of the system is denoted by $ x $, the control input by $ u $ and the measurements by $ y $, then the system dynamics is given as $ x_{k+1} = A x_{k} + B u_{k} + w_k $ and the measurement model is given by $ y_{k+1} = C x_{k+1} + D u_{k} + v_k $

simplesect.para: all matrices are assumed to be time-invariant

parameterdescription.para: control input matrix mapping inputs to states
output matrix mapping states to measurements
feed through matrix mapping inputs to measurements

simplesect.para: bool true/false if filter was constructed successfully or not

briefdescription.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.
This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.
Set initial state of the Kalman filter.

simplesect.para: this method must be called before calling kfInit()
bool true/false successful or not

briefdescription.para: Sets the state covariance matrix.

simplesect.para: this method must be called before calling kfInit()

parameterdescription.para: state covariance matrix of dimensions $ dim_x \times dim_x $

simplesect.para: bool true/false successful or not

briefdescription.para: Sets the system noise covariance matrix.

simplesect.para: this method must be called before calling kfInit()

parameterdescription.para: system noise covariance matrix of dimensions $ dim_x \times dim_x $

simplesect.para: bool true/false successful or not

briefdescription.para: Sets the measurement noise covariance matrix.

simplesect.para: this method must be called before calling kfInit()

parameterdescription.para: measurement covariance matrix of dimensions $ dim_y \times dim_y $

simplesect.para: bool true/false successful or not

briefdescription.para: This method checks if the filter is properly constructed and configured i.e.

detaileddescription.para:
if initial states and covariance matrices are set.
this method must be called before calling kfPredict() or kfUpdate()
bool true/false successful or not

briefdescription.para: Set inputs for the Kalman filter.

simplesect.para: bool true/false successful or not

briefdescription.para: Runs one step of the Discrete Kalman Filter prediction equation described by $ \hat{x}_{k+1} = A x_{k} + B u_{k} $ $ \hat{P}_{k+1} = A_k P_k A_k^T + Q $.

simplesect.para: this function can be called only after setting up the filter properly through kfInit() step
in case if B matrix is constructed, this function should be once called every step, after setting up the input vector using kfSetInputVector() method.
bool true/false if successful or not

briefdescription.para: Set measurements for the Kalman filter.

simplesect.para: bool true/false successful or not

briefdescription.para: Runs one step of the Discrete Kalman Filter update equation described by $ \tilde{y}_{k+1} = C \hat{x}_{k+1} + D u_{k} $ $ x_{k+1} = \hat{x}_{k+1} + K_{k+1}(\tilde{y}_{k+1} - z_{k+1}) $ $ P_{k+1} = (I - K_{k+1} C) \hat{P}_{k+1} $ where K is the Kalman gain.

simplesect.para: this function can be called only after setting up the filter properly through kfInit() step
this function should be once called every step, after setting up the measurements vector using kfSetMeasurementVector() method.
bool true/false if successful or not

briefdescription.para: Get system state.

simplesect.para: bool true/false successful or not

briefdescription.para: Get system state covariance.

parameterdescription.para: system state covariance matrix of dimension $ dim_x \times dim_x $

simplesect.para: bool true/false successful or not

briefdescription.para: Reset Kalman filter Resets the Kalman filter and initializes with the internally stored states and matrices initially set by the user.

memberdef.argsstring: (const iDynTree::VectorDynSize &x0, const iDynTree::MatrixDynSize &P0, const iDynTree::MatrixDynSize &Q, const iDynTree::MatrixDynSize &R)
memberdef.name: kfReset

briefdescription.para: Reset Kalman filter with the given arguments.

simplesect.para: the system matrices A, B, C and D are unchanged with the reset filter

parameterdescription.para: initial state vector of dimensions $ dim_x \times 1 $
state covariance matrix of dimensions $ dim_x \times dim_x $
system noise covariance matrix of dimensions $ dim_x \times dim_x $
measurement noise covariance matrix of dimensions $ dim_y \times dim_y $

briefdescription.para: Discrete Kalman Filter with additive Gaussian noise.

detaileddescription.para: The Kalman filter can be constructed by giving the system design matrices A, B, C and D. where A is the state transition matrix, B is the control input matrix, C is the output matrix and D the feed through matrix. These matrices can be used to describe a stochastic model for a linear dynamical system.

Once the filter is constructed, the system noise and measurement noise covariance matrices can be set. The filter can be run, after setting initial state and state covariance matrix. The filter init method is called to check if the filter is properly configured and is ready to use.

care must be taken to design these matrices with proper dimensions, so that the filter does not crash
Once the filter is configured, the filter algorithm can be run in a loop by,
setting input vector
prediction step which propagates the state through the modeled state dynamics
setting the measurement vector
correct the predicted states with the incoming measurements
